revised_title: Anatomical Study of the Squalus maximus and Its Stomach Structure
tldr: This article provides an in-depth anatomical account of the Squalus maximus, a large fish species, focusing on its stomach structure and its role as an intermediate link between whale and cartilaginous fishes. The author describes the fish's physical features, internal organs, and skeletal structure, highlighting the unique characteristics of its stomach and its contents. The study contributes to the understanding of the evolution and classification of marine animals.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Marine Biology
